head.title: Welcome to Wisconsin Rapids Public Schools

meta.name: description
meta.content: Wisconsin Rapids Public Schools homepage. See the latest news from the school district, links, calendar, staff contact information and mission statement.

li.a: Educator and Staff of the Year - Nominations

div.p: Students compete in annual Math 24 competition.
Elementary Children's Theatre presents "Frozen, Jr."
Lincoln High students present about Career & Tech Ed at Rotary.
Musical Boot Camp helped students learn more about theatre work.
Celebrating 100 days of school!
Howe students create summer snow people.
Gingerbread story theme was a hit with 4K!
Thank you to the family of Judy Gause for the books donation!
THINK students earned VIP tickets to a game at Lambeau!
ELL staff presenting to UWSP Aspiring Educators Club.
Howe Fuel Up team is all smiles!
DECA students collect enough food to feed over 540 families!
Students practice cursive handwriting skills.
Washington Elementary students thank our veterans.
Problem solving and teamwork at its best!
Third graders learn about the cranberry industry!
Students enjoy First Tee event at Sand Valley.
Fourth graders learning on field trip to Ho-Chunk Nation.
Agriculture students learn about food processing.
Celebrating the #GreatAppleCrunch!
Students learning about fire prevention from the experts.
Supt. Broeren accepts WRPS "Blue Door Award" from Boys & Girls Club.
Second graders use recycled materials to make magnificent things!
Students collaborate on the science of making butter.
Reading time fun! #learningtogether
Congratulations Lincoln High School!
Middle School students honor veterans.
Welcoming veterans home from 36th Annual Honor Flight.
Kindergarten students busy writing about a bird feeder activity.
9th grade geometry students creating kaleidoscopes in their math unit.
Woodside students participate in "Opera for the Young!"
THINK Academy students enjoy hands-on learning.
We would like to invite you to access our Virtual Nurses Office. You will be able to ask health-related questions pertaining to your school aged child(ren)...
